channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Spray tags on the upper steel panel of the BT phone kiosk, Lennard Rd, Penge 10m SE of the jct with Newlands Park., 15th January
item.description:
Spray tags on the upper steel panel of the BT phone kiosk, Lennard Rd, Penge 10m SE of the jct with Newlands Park. The lower panel has been over painted grey, so the upper tagged panel might also be painted - about 0.75sqm.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lennard Road, Penge, Greater London

item.description:

item.title: Massive Fly-tipping around Asda Charlton, 14th January
item.description:
Hi there, This is ongoing issue I reported to the council several times now. I also try to contact Greenwich Shopping Park - please do something about it as this is very off-putting. Especially, given there is food supermarket next to it. Asda, the whole Greenwich Shopping Park should be ashamed of the stage at that area. Best, L

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Gallions Road, Charlton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Could road and pavement around entrance to footpath be cleared please?, 14th January

Lots of slippery, rotting leaves on pavement and road. Can this be swept please?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cow Path, Elmstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti Report – Building / Electrical Door - -Black door on the building, above what appears to be an electrical hazard/warning sign (communal walkway), 14th January
item.description:
There are multiple graffiti signatures on and above the black door, including one clearly visible above the electrical hazard sign and another less visible black graffiti mark on the door itself. Each signature is approximately the size of a laptop. The graffiti is not offensive but negatively impacts the appearance of the communal area. This issue has been recurring since the start of the year, with new markings appearing recently. This is a shared residential walkway and the graffiti is visible to residents and visitors.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Penton Place, Elephant and Castle, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Grey cat dead on pavement, 14th January
item.description:
Not sire whats happened but theres blood in the blood on the pavement from the cat and the cat is dead
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Turnbury Close, Greater London

item.title: Abandoned Motorbike - No Number Plate, 14th January

item.title: Sign for Williamson Court (communal area), 14th January
item.description:
Graffiti has appeared on the Williamson Court sign. The graffiti consists of a black marker/paint signature, approximately the size of a laptop. It appeared recently and is not offensive, but it affects the appearance of the building and makes the entrance look neglected. This sign helps identify the building, so removal of the graffiti (rather than removal of the sign) would be preferred.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Penton Place, Elephant and Castle, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
